description: app freezes whenever i try to sign in to it

I thought it would be a local app that I can write my journal, it turns out it is internet based app and one needs to login ....
Where is end of privacy intrusion, it seems that there is no limit on how much companies would get into your private life. Considering all things that happen with invasion of privacy lately I do not know how they think we can trust them. Google above all.

When I was on windows I had this, then when work made me use an apple computer, I had this, and even on my chromebook I had this. I'm happy that now that I use ubuntu, I can still have this app. It's pricey, yet, but it's handy, consistent, and simply looks nice. I say you spend the money, but that's just me.

Very dissapointed, I had used this on my phone and Android tablet a few years ago and liked it, but it was free then, now they want you to go premium and pay.
I found if you access Journey from a web browser you can login and use it, with reduced functionality, although they try to get you to pay.
I have also re-installed on my phone and found, they try to get you to pay, but if you simply close the payment screen you can use it, all the entries I made years ago are still there.
A good idea, just annoyed at how they have monetised it.
summary: SHOULD SAY YOU CAN'T USE THE APP WITHOUT PAYING

description: I can write and review my journal entries across all my devices. This is an amazing app - so amazing that I opted to pay for it to support the developers. The fact that I can use this across all platforms is amazing beyond words.
It uses Google to login, I don't trust it or the company. It likely runs algorithms on all my personal entries and then sells the data.

its $20.

or monthly $3
There is nothing to say you MUST pay to use this app, but you do have to pay.
pay to use pay to use pay to use

Requires sign up, for a product that I just want to keep notes in. Requires strange permissions and likely desires my personal information.

 Typical parasitic info-seeker trash.
useless asdasdasdasd

I fell as though I was tricked into installing something that I have to pay to use. It's not the fact that you have to pay, although that annoys me too, but the fact that nowhere in the description does it warn you that they are going to charge you to use it.

The description should have mentioned that this is a PAID APP. Also I am not cool with all the data being stored on some server somewhere with no clear statement that my personal information will not be mined and sold to the highest bidder.
The description should explain that it you can't use it without subscribing!
i use this on my ipad. so nice to find in in ubuntu
I'm stuck at login in the "return to the app to continue".

What about a trial?
3 days should get it done, if you think it's too much, give us one day, 6 hours... I don't know, just let us try it out before having to send u some money. Please.

I bought the life time premium membership of this app in android 2 years ago. Around 7-8 months ago I was able to use this app on linux without any extra price. And now you have to pay the price to use this app on linux.

DO NOT SUBSCRIBE. They will continue to deteriorate services.
Don't recommend install. Maybe it leak you personal data.
summary: Worth service. Need login by google account in some strange way

description: essential info must include

It first do not say about the payment. it talks about payment only after you log in through google account. takes all the right on your google drive. 

no trying. no viewing. nothing. just payment!

This app can only be used if user agrees to buy a lifetime membership or a monthly subscription which is in dollars. In India the exchanged pricing is too high one can safely assume 99.99% folks would agree to have a choice first. Since without payment the app will terminate and close. 
Well now comes the trickster part, in order to start one has to login using mail account and in the process give this app permission to manage storage like G-Drive or One-Drive of the personal account. This is quite preposterous since if one does not agree to pay up later there is noway to delete the account or stop the permission of access to the drives associated with mails.
For gmail account one can remove the access inside the gmail account app permission but for other mail ids you are on your own.
summary: This app should be listed in Paid Apps or trickster app category

description: Stay away from this.
it ask you to buy pro version. without that you can use it.

I'm not one of those privacy-centered people, like some of these Linux extremists, so my review will be pro-Journey. This is a great journaling and note-taking tool which allows for audio notes, video attachments, image attachments, and also gives you inspiration daily by sending you tips, questions/quotes. I use "Tags" as folders, so I use Journey for Personal use, and also professional use.

Been using this app for about a month now and it works fine. I been using this on my phone and decided to add it on my laptop since it was available. Yes! You will need to pay for the full version but it is worth it.
Uses personal data from google
I already have premium on my android and Windows 10 but still have to pay for linux version. Greedy company

Why pay money to give your data to some corporation in the cloud? Get Typora or VSCode, open a github account, and store your journal entries in a repository, like it was code. I've been journaling and writing philosophy essays this way for almost 10 years, without fail. You don't need this app.

Ok, using the desktop app is convenient but the free web app has the same features.
